title: martyns
author: martyns
content: Nigeria is one of the countries that make election period a time to have enemity all over because they believe election can never be free and fair,and therefore, blood must be shed to get into certain political positions.It has been the way they operate,so the 2023 election is already giving heat about what will come.

comments.author: Majestic-milf
comments.body: Well, as it is in Nigeria, so it is in so many other places. Sometimes I'd say Nigeria has it less when it comes to election violence compared to countries like Kenya, India and even Russia.  For the case of Putin, he served as president since 2000-2008 and resumed power in 2012 till date. And people suspect his rise to power was not a fair and honest one. Nigeria just has the badluck of always voting in the wrong sets of leaders the moment few currencies has exchanged hands. I doubt that Nigerians experience much coercion during election though.

comments.author: Lordhermes
comments.body: Nigeria's viewpoint on the election is distinct from others'. because in Nigeria politics is regarded as a career. Politicians purchase high-tech weapons for young people running in elections, but they have trouble getting the weapons back from them afterward. resulting in a crisis after the election. Politicians are already recruiting lads to help them in their campaign for office in the upcoming 2023 election. The new electoral statute, which prevents manipulation and lessens electoral violence, was signed by Mr. President Buhari, which is wonderful news this time around. because the results of the election will be broadcast digitally.

comments.author: Die_empty
comments.body: Quote from: martyns on November 26, 2022, 04:11:36 AMNigeria is one of the countries that make election period a time to have enemity all over because they believe election can never be free and fair,and therefore, blood must be shed to get into certain political positions.It has been the way they operate,so the 2023 election is already giving heat about what will come.Nigerian politicians are the most desperate in the entire world because they can do anything to grab power. The reason for this is because the country lacks strong institutions that ensures that the constitution of the country is upheld. Elected political officeholders become emperors and despots because they are not checked by any institution. The legislature, executive and judiciary connive to loot the treasury of the country without any form of obstruction. The lucrativeness of these political officers now make politicians to do everything including instigating ethnic and religious crisis to win elections. They sponsor thugs that hijack ballot box or attack electoral officials because they want to win elections. Opposition or political opponents are intimidated and sometimes killed because they want to be silenced. Until politically offices in Nigeria ceases to becomes an avenue to become stupendously rich, electoral violence would not stop. If political office holders are persecuted and punished for the crime they committed during and after election, other would take note. The public especially the youth must also know that these politicians would never use their children to carryout these electoral crime because they know how risky it is. We must also take note that these politicians will also want the masses to be poor so that they can be easily used for these risky and violent electoral crimes.

comments.author: Frankolala
comments.body: Politicians in Nigeria are taking elections to be a do or die affair because that are corrupt people and are fighting for their personal interest,if they have good intention for the country, they will not make election a do or die affair since they will care more about the welfare of the people,instead of hiring thugs to kill people and steal ballot boxes.Politicians sees their offices as an opportunity to syphon public funds for themselves and their families instead of seeing the office as a medium to reach out to the people's needs and welfare. I will say that Nigeria Politicians are thieves in disguise and not politicians. This is known as abuse of power because Nigeria Politicians placed themselves above the law because the Judiciary is in their palm.

They have a common ground they agree on and that is how to loot the people's money. In Nigeria, the set of politicians we have are career politicians. They have no other trade or profession except to be in politics and steal public funds. This is why it is called a dirty game in Nigeria. In this coming election in 2023, we should not make it a do or die thing. Just be obidient and vote wisely.

comments.author: Majestic-milf
comments.body: Election in Nigeria will always be a period where citizens would be apathetic towards the electoral activities because despite the beautiful manifestos issued by these contesting candidates, you'd still notice that deep down what they are most concerned about is how they can move from one level of corruption to the other as soon as they win and enter power. We are not strangers to the cases of violence during the election period as it only goes to show how these peeps can go to obvious lengths just to get a slice of the national cake.  Former Nigerian Head of State, Gen. Abdusalami Abubakar also believes that some electorates are to be blamed as they allow themselves be swayed by sweet talks and gifts, but hopes that the 2023 election coming up will be different. I hope so too.

We hope for change in the electoral process due to the advent of technology.

OP I hope you have your PVC cause it is a tool to peaceful elections as we all hope for.

comments.author: Lordhermes
comments.body: Just yesterday, the national security adviser to the president instructed the inspector general of police to direct each state's police commissioner to refrain from carrying out any executive orders issued by governors against opposition parties in their respective States. that governors are enacting laws to repress opposition parties in their states, and that police commissioners shouldn't be used as instruments for these laws. Additionally, any commissioners found complicit in the repression and intimidation of opposition parties by state governors will be dismissed.It is documented that governors issue executive orders to stop opposition candidates from holding events or putting up campaign signs in their states. These directives are harmful to the voting process in Nigeria. Additionally, the police inspector general must take action to stop

comments.author: Majestic-milf
comments.body: Next year's election would prove to be a herculean task as the country is riddled with insecurity and also one has to ensure the INEC is ready as this would be the seventh consecutive general election since Nigeria went back to democracy in 1999. Insecurity will prove a difficult matter to solve since it seems most of the people in power are the perpetrators of this anomaly.

comments.author: suzanne5223
comments.body: I have never seen a country where the election is never free and fair. Either the system is corrupt or some naive citizen allows the political theft to use them as a weapon to reach the official through false ways because the result in the bailout box is what the electoral body will announce.Africa needs to stand for their right and do things right once and for all.

comments.body: Quote from: martyns on November 26, 2022, 04:11:36 AMThe 2023 election is already giving heat to what will come.We should not predict the outcome of the 2023 elections based on what has been witnessed in the previous elections in Nigeria as a matter of fact, the 2023 election is going to be different from other elections because the citizens of Nigeria have been clamoring for change and I believe the youths especially will make use of this opportunity to vote for a credible candidate that will bring a positive change in the economy of the country. The heat I see is the fact that some blind politicians are still campaigning for candidates whom they know that has nothing good to offer for the development of the country.

I believe that Nigerian politics are fundamentally corrupt. It is a way for the privileged class to get wealthier. Everyone who enters politics or is given a leadership position does so with the primary goal of enriching his family and siphoning government funds for his unborn children's generation. Taking into account the severity of the situation in the nation(hardship).Another aspect is that even the wealthy use politics as the fastest and surest means to make hard currency in the nation. even if it causes the poor to become further poorer. My argument is that our so-called heroes' past gave birth to Nigerian politics in that way, and until something cruel happens by removing the corrupt leaders, it will continue to be their ordeal of "do or die election"
